I should be sleeping right about now, but I can't.  I have only three more days of work left and I'm not even going to be able to make it in on time tomorrow.  It seems as if this livejournal phase has ended, and myspace has taken over.  The only person that really updates religiously still appears to be matt.  Very impressive my friend :D  

Lets talk about college.  All I wanted was a cluster.  A F-ing cluster.  I drew pictures of it and everything.  Instead I got a dungeon.  The worst dorm on campus.  Mercer.  It's highly recommended that freshmen girls in particular switch immediately.  Let me give you a mental picture:
The room is a brick block.  Walls floor everything=brick.  The only windows are in the hallway.  Smallest rooms and closets on campus.  One coed bathroom every other floor of the 5 floor building.  I'm on 4, I don't have a bathroom.  Oldest, creepiest coldest building.  Laundry/microwave is in the creepy basement which has one overhead pull light and no windows.  You're two blocks away from anything else on campus...basically locked away in the woods.  One girl said that she forced herself to think of it as her castle after she couldn't get a switch just to make it through the year.  To be completely honest...I don't want to pay $30,000 to live in a horror movie all year.   Everyone said that no one wants to come visit you because you are so far away...and after a vote of 1,000 students, it came out last in every category except for quietest and least social...both of which it came in first.  I have my advising date this weekend, so hopefully I will go and see for myself and hopefully be able to do something about it if it is as bad as it sounds.  I can't believe I'm hating college already.  

Hmm...I had a pretty good day today.  I went to greg's neighbors party and it was pretty funny.  Greg was in charge of parking cars so I pretty much just rolled around in the grass while he made an attempt to get people to roll down their windows so he could tell them where to park their car.  His neighbor is seriously one of the weirdest people I've ever met.  Just yesterday when I pulled up to his house I saw eric(the neighbor)  coming down the street in just shorts pulling behind him an empty radio flyer(ya know, a little red wagon)  for no apparent reason.  It was just nuts!

Mmmmhhhh next topic: video games.  We got three new games for the 64 this weekend and I must say..WOW.  Game #1:  Mischief makers.  This game is awful.  Shake shake, shake shake.   Game #2:  some game with a demon on the front who's name I can't remember.  We cant find the memory pack, so this game isn't really fun.  It's pretty much just the same thing over and over again.  It is however, two player.  Major plus.  Game #3:  The awesome MEGAMAN!  wow.  I haven't had this much fun playing a game since vexx.  It's great.  Only right now we're stuck at this part and it's awful because we just can't beat it no matter what we do.  I'm sure we will eventually...It's just so hard!!!  Let me describe it.  There is a big boss machine and you have to shoot out his tires and then jump on his platform to shoot in the hatch all while bombs are being thrown at you and tanks are shooting at you and mechanical birds are blowing up on you.  Bottom line:  I love this game.  If you have a 64...buy it.  It was only $12 or something.  I love my 64.  

Alright it's bed time.  Duty calls tomorrow...but only for three more days! and then I'm off to seattle!!! I'm pretty sure I can make it!


Loves

it's late, and I'm awake.  There's no better time than the middle of the night to update a livejournal.  Today was pretty crummy.  I don't know why, but nothing really seemed to be going my way.  I woke up to a call from Greg.  He had to drive around for his dad and wanted me to come.  I was excited so I jumped out of bed and got in the shower.  For some reason, it was nothing like I expected.  We couldn't find the last place we were supposed to go and it just got tense and kind of sucked at the end.  So I came home and watched sweet home alabama for the 80th time.  
We also don't have any food in our house.  I hate it when we're foodless.  My mom has been in the worst mood lately.  I can't wait for college.  Anyway, so then Greg and i watched beauty and the geek..the weirdest show ever.  Followed by a short trip which also didn't turn out as I had expected.  I think today is just one of those nights where I need to go to sleep, wake up, and pretend the whole day was a bad dream.  

Summer has been really odd.  No one seems to be themselves.  Alex, Natalie, Greg and I were supposed to have a Degrassi party tomorrow, but I don't know if that's going to happen.  I think I need to stop having expectations.  I guess I just had so many for this summer...potentially my last summer with high school friends...and it just is kind of turning into a dud.  I know I still have 3 months left...but I feel let down I guess.  Maybe I'm just in a depressed mood so everything seems bluer than it truly is.  

Greg and I had dinner at my dad's the other night and it turned out pretty well.  We showed him our pictures from the cruise(which was amazing by the way:D) and he showed us pictures from his china trip.  Everyone was civilized and had a good time.  It was also nice to have a full meal with familiar foods and what not.  Mom doesn't really cook anymore...and we NEVER have table dinners, so I  thoroughly enjoyed it.  His new girlfriend was there too.  At first, I didn't really like her, but she's growing on me.  REALLY high maintenance, and not at all who I would ever see my dad with, but she tries really hard and she's super nice.  

arg, I think I need to try and sleep.  tomorrow will be a better day, I'm sure of it.  more sun :D  I can't wait until my new harry potter book comes!!  no later than 7:00pm on saturday!! YIPPEE!!!

~Kris

Well, high school is over, and summer has begun.  I figured since I have all of this new found free time I would resurrect my old friend the live journal.    I told Cathy that I wouldn't, but I just can't help myself.  It's so much fun.  I leave for my cruise in 3 days.  3 DAYS!!!!!  I can't even believe it!  but I'm taking my computer with me so I'll be sure to make lots of updates about all of the cool things we see.  I can't believe that highschool is actually over either.  I think it just set in today.  It's nothing like I expected it to be.  Graduation was over so fast, and then the grad party flew by.  I just don't know.  Now it seems that there are all these new weird tensions that weren't there before.  A week ago I was just worrying about homework, getting signatures in my yearbook, making up PE miles, and which pair of my shoes were flattest with the most traction to insure an embarrassment free commencement ceremony.  Now I'm worrying about things like having to go to work, leaving all of my friends, going on trips to other countries without mommy and daddy, and what i'm going to eat for breakfast at 2:00pm.  Even though it's just another summer, it surly doesn't feel the same.  

I've found that in reading live journal posts like this one, which promises to be WAY too long, it's nice to have breaks every now and then.  This is one of those breaks.  There are about 20 million grad parties today, and all I want to do is sleep.  I don't see why people planned them all on the same day.  I mean, don't the people having the parties want to go to other people's parties too?  I know I don't feel like getting out of my sweats, but I love my friends, so I will.  Also,  there is no way that I can make it to everyone's today.  It's sad.  I have to pick the most important ones, or the ones closest together, and that really sucks.  I hate doing that.  I remember 2 years ago when all of my friends graduated and I went party hoppin and it was so much fun.  All of us non graduating kids just got in a car and ran around all day seeing people that I haven't really seen since.  I suppose I'm just afraid that this time it's real.  These people are my closest friends who I've known for like, 10 years.  I don't want to not see them ever ever again.

Everyone is talking about losing their innocents, and entering the real world, but I really don't think that graduation from high school symbolizes that at all.  I don't think that I've been a kid for quite some time now, although I try to revert back whenever I can, and I think that this summer is going to be crazy, and more childlike than any other.  Trying to cram as much in with everyone you care about before they're gone.  Also, I would, in no way call college the real world.  That my friends, is where we will lose our innocents.  High school was day care compared to what faces us ahead.  After that - college graduation.  That is the real entrance to the world.  That is when we are truly left to fend for ourselves.  We don't have our parents or a place to live.  We need to get a stable job and start to form our own lives.  Entering College will be nothing compared to those feelings of loss and confusion.

Lets recap the grad party:  We got there around 10:30, and went straight into the gym.  There I played the throw the basketball into the hoop game, and totally knocked over all of the beads.  She gave me some b/c she felt sorry for me.  Then we ended up in the casino-of course.  Greg and I played black jack for a while, but I was totally kicking their butts :D, so we stopped, and he went over to play poker while I went and played DDR with david.  Oh my was that just awful.  We have no rhythm  AT ALL!  not to mention I kept stepping back to hit that arrow and missing completely.  Then we would start to laugh and I just lost it.  Needless to say we did horribly.  After that I married James.  How fun.  Salness was the best minister ever.  Throughout the night I made a key chain with jessie and james, won 2 pairs of boxers and 2 flip flops at boxer bingo, burned my hands in tug-o-war. laughed hysterically at the hypnotizer, won $15 for Target, and stood in aw at the fireworks, half asleep.  Then I came home and slept on the couch because Amanda was taking up the whole bed. Then end

I think this was a pretty good welcome back post.  I'm pretty sure I have to go take a shower and be on my way...even though all I want to do is lay around and watch movies.  Doesn't it feel like a movie watching day?

Loves.

I know I haven't used this in about a million years, but this is a serious entry worth taking the time to read if you're one of my good friends.

This summer i've neglected everyone.  I haven't called people back or gone the extra mile to hang out with ANYONE.  Even the people I would consider my best friends.  I've been a shut in if you will.  the only thing that i've done since school got out is work, and sit at home in my room by myself.  I guess i've hung out w/ greg too....but when i'm not doing that, it's work, or being shut in.  I am SO sorry for the people I've hurt and friends I've lost and I hope that you aren't ready to chuck me out the door of a moving car on the highway.  This year a lot of things in my life have changed.  my parents got a divorce and tres and dad moved out, my mom lost her job and became addicted to her new boyfriend and in turn we lost any relationship we had, and I got the worst grades of my life and basically ruined everything.  We're selling our house not by choice and have no idea where we're going when someone decides to buy it or how we're going to afford to live there.  i stopped going to church regularly and hanging out with everyone and I jsut layed in bed doing nothing.  I guess none of this really caught up to me until summer started and I had time to think about it all.  Please forgive me for being such an awful friend.  I'm working really hard to try and make things better.  I suppose I just realized in the past week or so when I started seeing people again that i really messed up and need to fix myself.  I honestly am sorry....and I promise things will be better soon.  I don't really know waht to say...but I hope this helps as some sort of explanation of why I have sucked so badly recently.

I hate change.  I've really come to realize how awful I am at dealing with it.  I always just want to live in that little comfortable bubble where you're still suffering, but it's familiar suffering that I've come to know and love in my own way.  Stepping outside of the comfort bubble could open up a whole new pain that isn't anything like the old pain, only it is.  So the minute you work up the guts to jump off of the road already traveled, all you want is to push away the new road, and fly back to the old.  you try so hard to hold on as tightly as possible until your hands start to bleed but even that pain is better then the unfamiliar.  Every once in a while, a change comes along, and you welcome it, only it's so small that no one around you even notices because no one ever really looks close enough at anyone else.  But to you, to you it's life altering and earth shaking.  All you want is some recognition that you've accepted what's changed, and that this is a big step for you, but that's impossible.  Therefore, you get the new pain all over again.  This makes you hope and wish and pray that this is the last time that you have to change.  That it's all over and this will be your life forever, regardless of it's standings.  
Choices aren't so hot either.  you can never know which is the right one until you do it.  and what if you're forced to make a decision before you know all the facts and later you realize that the path chosen was the wrong one...only, you're not the only one involved so you hurt people that you love.  What if the new choice makes you miss old ones but there's nothing you can do to go back.  Choices are all just a game of what ifs.
